title: Hotdog-Sandwich Consensus Framework

prerequisites: Secure participation from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: Create a legitimate, authoritative body to define hotdog taxonomy
risks: Difficulty gaining buy-in from all stakeholders
Potential for council decisions to be seen as biased or unrepresentative

prerequisites: Gather input from culinary experts, linguists, and the public
Analyze structural, cultural, and practical considerations
steps.outcome: Establish a classification system that balances structural and cultural factors
risks: Potential for ongoing debate over borderline cases

steps.action: Implement Flexible Labeling and Menu Standards
prerequisites: Socialize new taxonomy framework with restaurants and regulators
Provide guidance on consistent labeling and menu presentation
steps.outcome: Enable peaceful coexistence of hotdog and sandwich categories
risks: Resistance from traditionalists to any concessions on labeling
Potential consumer confusion over hybrid terminology

prerequisites: Develop engaging content explaining the new taxonomy
Distribute through media, schools, and community channels
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the hybrid framework
risks: Difficulty overcoming entrenched views on both sides
Potential for continued debate and divisiveness

steps.action: Establish Ongoing Governance and Dispute Resolution
prerequisites: Empower the Classification Council to monitor and refine the taxonomy
Develop clear procedures for handling classification challenges and appeals
steps.outcome: Maintain stability and legitimacy of the hybrid framework over time
risks: Potential for the Council to be seen as biased or ineffective
Ongoing disputes and legal challenges from hardline stakeholders

resource_requirements: Diverse Council of culinary, linguistic, and regulatory experts
Public relations and marketing budget for education campaign
Legal and policy support for developing taxonomy and dispute resolution
Coordination with major food service industry associations
